channel.title: Server too big?
channel.description: Hi one day i was running my server and it was running fine i turned it off for 2 hours i turned back on after then and it would not run that well it was lagging so much i couldnt move. I pressed crt + alt+ delete then it said it was using up all my cpu usage then i turned it down to below average (the priority level) and then my client was faster but now i have a lagg that take 2 minutes for me to take 1 step plz plz help any 1?[br][size=1]Posted on: April 17, 2007, 12:49:33 PM[/size][hr]some 1 plz help

item.title: Server too big?
item.dc:creator: @Goodoo_dolls Goodoo dolls
item.description:
@Goodoo_dolls wrote:

i tried it doesnt do anything i need help i might have to make a new server

Read full topic

item.title: Server too big?
item.dc:creator: @fedexer -fedexer-
item.description:
@fedexer wrote:

honestly chris , that wasnt what i was striving for… you people havent noticed that antilag.java does nothing more than create lag?

it never closes its java.exe, it always makes new ones = more lag for you

i suggest looking for a server restarter program…

Read full topic

item.title: Server too big?
item.dc:creator: @bluurr bluurr
item.description:
@bluurr wrote:

open your antilag and change this

public void process()
{
ResetTimer += 1;
if(ResetTimer >= 1800)
{
resetserver();
}
}

to this compile and it should stop it but it will mess up your restarter

public void process()
{
ResetTimer += 1;
if(ResetTimer >= 99999999)
{
resetserver();
}
}

Read full topic
